summary: Funding is a crucial aspect of various initiatives aimed at preserving the unique and diverse nature of the web. It supports efforts to maintain internet freedom, promote open-source principles, and encourage innovative thinking. This theme is closely associated with digital advocacy, creative exploration, and the maker movement. It emphasizes the importance of financial backing for projects that challenge conventional norms, foster digital ownership, and resist corporate uniformity in the online space. By supporting such endeavors, funding plays a vital role in keeping the web weird, open, and user-driven.
excerpt: Keep The Web Weird encourages engagement with ISOC for internet advocacy, embracing open-source principles, exploring digital fabrication, adopting guerrilla-style creativity, and championing digital ownership to foster innovation and preserve internet freedom.
